subject: World Cup (Skiing)
Bone Fractures
lead_paragraph: Aksel Lund Svindal, the defending overall World Cup champion, could be sidelined for up to six weeks after surgery following a serious training accident. A team of three doctors operated simultaneously on Svindal for nearly five hours at the Vail Valley Medical Center in Beaver Creek, Colo., to repair a deep gash in his left buttock and broken bones to his face and nose.
